alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 20 at 7:48PM PDT until October 21 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Surf of 3 to 5 feet with local sets to 6 feet is expected on west facing beaches through late tonight. A high risk of rip currents will continue through Saturday afternoon. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast and Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast. * WHEN...Until 3 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast
